page.title: 05 Farming in the Keith area
page.content: The farming around Keith is mainly mixed farming with both crops and livestock important.Barley is the main cereal crop.Much grass is grown to be made into silage or hay for feeding to livestock in winter,along with turnips. The livestock consists mainly of beef cattle and sheep.Most of the cattle are Hereford-Friesian crosses and many are also cross-bred with continental bulls such as the Limousin and Charolais.On higher land where grazing is poorer, more sheep are kept.Main breeds include the Blackface,Leicester and Suffolk.The lambs are mostly sold for meat apart from some ewe lambs which are kept for breeding.There is a livestock mart in Keith where cattle and sheep are bought and sold. Near Keith there are two dairy farms - Drum Farm and Birkenburn which supply fresh milk to the local area.
